conclusion: Analyzing liquid flow paths through baffles to predict which container it will flow into.
At the top: Colored blocks labeled A, B, C, D (from left to right).
At the bottom: House-shaped containers labeled E, F, G (from left to right).
In between: Various colored rods/baffles that will redirect the liquid flow.
The second and third images show the actual flow patterns developing.
Liquid starts from the leftmost yellow container at top.
Flows downward following the yellow path.
Hits the orange horizontal baffle, which diverts it to the left.
Continues down along the left edge of the board.
Flows into the leftmost house-shaped container (E).
Liquid starts from the green container (second from left).
Flows downward following the green path.
Hits the orange horizontal baffle at an angle.
Gets diverted along various internal paths.
Eventually flows to the left side of the board.
Based on image 3, the liquid appears to ultimately flow into container E.
Liquid starts from the light blue/teal container (third from left).
Flows downward following the teal path.
Navigates around several baffles, including the gray one.
Based on image 3, the liquid follows a path to the middle bottom section.
Flows into the middle house-shaped container (F).
Liquid starts from the blue container (fourth from left).
Flows downward following the blue path.
Hits the blue horizontal baffle, which diverts it.
Continues down the right side of the board.
